title.native: スクールガールストライカーズ Animation Channel

description:
An adaptation of Square Enix's smartphone "light novel-style RPG" app Schoolgirl Strikers.

The game is set in Goryōkan Academy, a new private senior/junior high school for girls with a vast downtown campus. This highly popular school has "another face" — a secret hidden side. It organizes and trains the special unit Fifth Force to protect the world from invisible supernatural entities known as "Oburi" that are devouring the world. A team of five trained with powers against the Oburi is to be chosen from the student body to perform missions. A new team leader has been appointed to assemble the five students.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).
**Yuusuke Onoda** is a Japanese director and episode director.
